alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 22 at 1:22PM CDT until July 22 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN HOUSTON...JACKSON...NORTHEASTERN HOLMES...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHERN DECATUR...MILLER... SOUTHERN EARLY AND SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 222 PM EDT/122 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Colquitt to 12 miles southeast of Cottonwood to 6 miles north of Chipley, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Chipley, Graceville, Donalsonville, Marianna, Bainbridge, Malone, Cottondale, Greenwood, Alford, Madrid, Gordon, Iron City, Campbellton, Brinson, Noma, Jakin, Bascom and Crosby. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
